page.title: 09The River Dunt
page.content: The stream runs from Middle Duntisbourne through Daglingworth to the Manor House and is the reason for the settlement and prosperity of the valley through the ages. Now it is merely a pleasant amenity. From the children's studies of the upper stream, we found that the creatures living there included stonefly and mayfly larvae, masses of freshwater shrimps and tadpoles, flatworms, snails and 3 ducks. Lower down the stream the water creatures changed and we found that it showed signs of pollution for there were thousands of tiny plant leeches, mosquito larvae and red roundworms as well as snails. Perhaps cattle or building works had caused the pollution. The stream was flowing very fast due to heavy rains this year.
